title: Best Practices For Patient Care
content:
Adults
60 through 74 years
of age with certain medical conditions or other risk factors that increase their risk for severe RSV disease should receive RSV vaccination if they haven't been previously vaccinated.
Clinical guidance
Best practices for immunizations
View Larger
Download
Give COVID-19 vaccines any time of the year. Ideally, give flu vaccines in early fall. The ideal timing for RSV immunization varies for older adults, pregnant women, and infants.
Detailed CDC guidance
